class SFG.orm.importer.Importer¶

Bases: object

extract_lt_file(file)¶

A function extracting the measurement data from a SFG spectral file

extract_other_spectra(file, sep='\t', skip=0)¶

Extracts the data from UV, IR and Raman measurements

extract_sfg_file(file)¶

A function extracting the measurement data from a SFG spectral file

import_liftoffs(file)¶

Imports the lift-off points determined manually from a file

import_lt(head_dir)¶

Imports LT data and collects the raw data by calling the extract_lt_function(). It adds addtional metadata like creation timestamp, measured and name.

import_other_spectra()¶
import_salinity()¶
import_sfg(parent_dir)¶

SFG import function, calls extract_sfg_file() to collect the actual measurement file, extracts the file creation timestamp, measurer and name and packs it in a form suitable for persistence

import_substances(file)¶

Extracts the information about predefined subtances out of the corresponding file

import_tensions(file)¶

SFG.orm.orm module¶

Created on Tue Jun 25 11:42:19 2019

@author: lange

ORM-part of SQlalchemy

class SFG.orm.orm.DatabaseWizard¶

Bases: object

factory(dic)¶

A convenience class to create the classes for sqlalchemy ORM. The information to create the tables are stored in dictionaries (class attributes of the DatabaseWizard)

class SFG.orm.orm.ImportDatabaseWizard¶

Bases: SFG.orm.orm.DatabaseWizard

This class is designed to take care about the initial raw data import from the measurement files. It provides the same declarative classes as the base class DatabaseWizard and will integrate with the class for the actual data interaction WorkDatabaseWizard. It makes use of the Importer class, delegating all raw data import and preprocessing to it. Usually, the function performing the object- relational mapping is called “persist_x”, but in case of complex import operations there may be two cooperatig functions write_x and persist_x.

static nparray_to_str(array)¶
persist_lt(dic)¶

Generates an instance of the declarative lt class and fills it with the data obtained from the importer.

persist_sfg(dic)¶

Generates an instance of the declarative sfg class and fills it with the data obtained from the importer.

persist_spectra()¶

Generates declarative class instances for UV, Raman and IR data.

persist_substances()¶

Processes the subtances dataset by generating instances of the declarative substances class.

persist_tensions()¶

Processes the surface tension dataset by iterating over the table rows, creating instances of the declarative class and filling it with the data.

write_lt()¶

Iterates over all folders containing LT files. Calls the write_lt() for each file.

write_sfg()¶

Iterates over all folders containing SFG files. Calls the persist_sfg() for each file.

class SFG.orm.orm.LtTokenizer¶

Bases: object

static process(string)¶
regex = {'conc': re.compile('\\d+(.\\d)?mM$'), 'measurement_no': re.compile('#\\d'), 'ratio': re.compile('\\dto\\d'), 'sample_no': re.compile('x\\d'), 'sensitizer': re.compile('BX\\d'), 'speed': re.compile('^\\d.\\d*$'), 'spreading_volume': re.compile('\\d\\d(ul)?$'), 'surfactant': re.compile('\\wA')}¶
class SFG.orm.orm.PostProcessor(database_wizard, new=True)¶

Bases: object

The PostProcessor class is designed to work with the ImportDatabaseWizard. While the IDW just initially populates the database with the raw data, the PP creates relationships (eg. between samples, stations and measurements) and adds additional data like Lift-off points.

add_lift_off()¶

A function adding the manually determined lift-off points to the gasex_lt table.

add_regular_info()¶

This function iterates over all regular type SFG objects, performs the name refinement provided in refine_regular() and persists this information in the regular_sfg table.

add_regular_lt_info()¶

This function iterates over all regular type SFG objects, performs the name refinement provided in refine_regular() and persists this information in the regular_sfg table.

add_salinity()¶

This function adds information about the “official” station label, geographical position and salinity (surface and depth) to the station’s table

disconnect()¶
static generate_hashdic(namestring)¶
static get_hashes(name)¶

Extract the hashes from file names. Remember to strip the file ending as well as the leading LT or date before passing namestring to this function.

static get_station_from_sample(sample_hash)¶
get_substances()¶

This function queries the db_wizard’s session for the substances to use this information for the regular_refine() method.

map_samples()¶

Maps the sample table to the corresponding station id (foreign key

map_tensions()¶

Maps the surface tension table (GasEx) to the corresponding samples

populate_gasex_tables()¶

This function iterates over the gasex_sfg spectra and gasex_lt isotherms, extracts information about corresponding samples and stations and matches them to their ids. In the course of this method, the stations, samples, gasex_lt and gasex_sfg tables are populated.

static process_sample_hash(hash)¶
static process_station_hash(hash)¶
refine_regular(namestring)¶

This function parses the names of the spectra in the sfg table with the type “regular” in order to extract additional metainformation. It makes use of regular expressions.

class SFG.orm.orm.WorkDatabaseWizard¶

Bases: SFG.orm.orm.DatabaseWizard

static construct_lt(or_object) → SFG.spectrum.spectrum.LtIsotherm¶

A function constructing the LT object from the orm declarative class.

static construct_sfg(or_object) → SFG.spectrum.spectrum.SfgSpectrum¶

A function constructing the SFG object from the orm declarative class.

convert_regular_to_lt(reg_lt) → SFG.spectrum.spectrum.LtIsotherm¶

Converts a RegularLt object directly into the Lt object of the spectrum module.

convert_regular_to_sfg(reg_sfg) → SFG.spectrum.spectrum.SfgSpectrum¶

Converts a RegularSfg object directly into the Sfg object of the spectrum module. It remains the former regular_sfg object as part of the new spectrum’s meta attribute for access of the metadata stored in the regular_sfg object.

fetch_by_specid(specid, sfg=True) → SFG.spectrum.spectrum.AbstractSpectrum¶

Fetches the SFG spectrum with the id specid from the database and retuns it as an SFG spectrum object.

get_dppc_references() → Dict[datetime.date, float]¶

A function querying the sfg table for DPPC reference spectra, generating the corresponding objects, calculating the CH integral making use of the SfgAverager class and returning a dictionary of date objects with the corresponding intensities.

get_spectrum_by_name(name) → SFG.spectrum.spectrum.SfgSpectrum¶

Returns the SFG spectrum object for a given file name

get_spectrum_by_property(property_, target) → SFG.spectrum.spectrum.SfgSpectrum¶

A convenience function to collect spectra based on properties like surfactant, sensitizer etc.

map_data_to_dates(data) → Dict[datetime.date, List[SFG.spectrum.spectrum.AbstractSpectrum]]¶

This function maps a list of spectra to their corresponding date of measurement

static to_array(string) → numpy.ndarray¶

Converts the raw data stored as strings back to numpy float ndarrays.
